  RXN_MSL_ASSISTANCE_XBD_RT = 1 << 1,

  RXN_MSL_ASSISTANCE_SYNCHRO = 1 << 3,
  RXN_MSL_ASSISTANCE_REF_TIME = 1 << 4,
  RXN_MSL_ASSISTANCE_ALL = 0xFFFFFFFF
}

 This function starts an asynchronous assistance request. In order to be notified when assistance is available, register as an observer using the observer interface.

 Un-Initialize Mobile Suite Library (MSL).
U16 RXN_MSL_Work (void)
 Give the Mobile Suite Library implementation time to perform PGPS tasks.
U16 RXN_MSL_WriteEphemeris (RXN_FullEphem_u PRNArr, U08 ArrSize, RXN_constel_t constel)
 Write an array of broadcast ephemeris data into the MSL. It is preferable to use RXN_MSL_WriteSingleEphemeris() instead so that it is possible to determine whether the ephemeris for a specific PRN was written successfully.
U16 RXN_MSL_WriteSingleEphemeris (RXN_Ephemeris_u *eph, RXN_constel_t constel)
 Write broadcast ephemeris data into the MSL. To enable optimal collections for autonomous mode this function should be called periodically at 5 minute intervals regardless of GPS fix status to ensure in a general use case of 20 minutes it will make at least 3 collections.

Detailed Description

The Mobile Suite API for Rx Networks technologies.

The Mobile Suite Library (MSL) will support a unified interface to all GPStream products. GL implementation will start and stop threads. These threads will perform all tasks required to generate EE. The GL API will also contain functions to support getting assistance (EE and anciliary data) as well as functions to support setting broadcast ephemeris records within autonomous mode to support EE creation.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum MSL_Reset_Type

Enumeration of factory reset type.

Enumerator:
MSL_RESET_INVALID 

Invalid reset type. No factory reset will be executed.

MSL_RESET_SEED 

Remove all data from eph and pred folders.

MSL_RESET_TIME 

Reset all sources of GPS time supplied (SNTP and through the API call RXN_MSL_SetGPSTime().

MSL_RESET_SEED_AND_TIME 

Remove all data from eph and pred folders and reset time.

enum RXN_CellStatus

Enumeration of cell status info. Based on OMA-TS-ULP V1.0 section 8.3.

Enumerator:
RXN_CELLSTATUS_STALE 

Status is stale.

RXN_CELLSTATUS_CURRENT 

Status is current.

RXN_CELLSTATUS_UNKNOWN 

Status is unknown.

U16 RXN_MSL_Abort ( BOOL  bAbort  ) 

Abort generating ephemeris.

Parameters:
bAbort [In] TRUE to set the abort flag or FALSE to clear the abort flag.
Returns:
RXN_SUCCESS if the abort flag is set successfully (always).

Description
Use this function to set or clear the abort flag for generating ephemeris. Generating ephemeris can require significant processing time. Integrators can use this function to abort any ephemeris generation thay may be in progress when the receiver is getting assistance data or for reducing power consumption.

See Also
RXN_MSL_GetEphemeris()

Example Usage 

 // Declare a storage for assistance data.
 RXN_MSL_Assistance_t assistData;

 memset((void*) &assistData, 0, sizeof(RXN_MSL_Assistance_t));

 // Abort generating ephemeris.
 RXN_MSL_Abort(TRUE);
 
 // Get assistance from the MSL.
 Result = RXN_MSL_GetEphemeris(0xFFFFFFFF, &assistData, RXN_GPS_CONSTEL);
 
 // Allow generating ephemeris.
 RXN_MSL_Abort(FALSE);

void RXN_MSL_Factory_Reset ( enum MSL_Reset_Type  resetType  ) 

Delete all pantry data from file system.

Parameters:
resetType [In] The enumeration of reset type.

Description
This will remove all data from eph and pred folders and/or reset time.

Example Usage 

 // Delete all pantry data from file system and reset time.
 RXN_MSL_Factory_Reset(MSL_RESET_SEED_AND_TIME);
U16 RXN_MSL_Get_API_Version ( char  version[RXN_CONSTANT_VERSION_STRING_LENGTH]  ) 

Retrieve the Mobile Suite Library (MSL) API version.

Parameters:
version [OUT] A memory location to be filled with the current API version. This is a null terminated string and is at most RXN_CONSTANT_VERSION_STRING_LENGTH (50) characters long.
Returns:
RXN_SUCCESS If the version is returned successfully (always).

Description
This function returns the version of the MSL API. The version number will be incremented as new features, enhancements, and bug fixes are added to the MSL API. The version number is an important identification when reporting and troubleshooting issues. Rx Networks version numbers are broken down within Integration Users Manuals and API Manuals.

Example Usage 

 // Declare a string to hold version info.
 char version[RXN_CONSTANT_VERSION_STRING_LENGTH];
 
 // Retrieve and output version information.
 RXN_MSL_Get_API_Version(version);
 printf("RXN_MSL_Get_API_Version(): %s\n", version);

Output
RXN_MSL_Get_API_Version(): 1.0.0

U16 RXN_MSL_Get_CL_Config_Str ( char  clConfigStr[RXN_MSL_CONFIG_MAX_STR_LEN]  ) 

Get the configuration string for chipset initialization.

Parameters:
clConfigStr [Out] Return the configuration string with port to open during chipset initialization as well as any other config parameters. The format of the config string is chipset dependent. Some chipsets (typically those supported by a host library or protocol interface) are initialized with a com port string and baudrate. Note that a debug log severity max level and debug zone mask are also stipulated. See details in <RXN_CL.h> RXN_CL_Initialize().
Returns:
RXN_SUCCESS if the chipset configuration string is returned successfully (always).

Description
Get the chipset configuration string used to connect to the GPS receiver. This string is configured in MSLConfig.txt

Example Usage 

 // Declare a string to hold chipset configuration string.
 char gCL_ConfigStr[RXN_CL_CONFIG_MAX_STR_LEN];

 if(RXN_MSL_Get_CL_Config_Str(gCL_ConfigStr) != RXN_SUCCESS)
 {
     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
 }
U16 RXN_MSL_GetAssistance ( U32  prnBitMask,
RXN_MSL_Assistance_t *  pAssist,
RXN_constel_t  constel 
)

Get assistance data from the Mobile Suite Library.

Deprecated:
This function has been deprecated and will be removed in a future release. RXN_MSL_GetEphemeris() should be used instead.
See also:
RXN_MSL_GetEphemeris
U32 RXN_MSL_GetBestGPSTime ( void   ) 

Get the current GPS time.

Returns:
The number of seconds since GPS start.

Description
MSL implementation requires target-specific support for getting the current GPS time. This value may also be required outside the MSL by integration applications. It is for the above reason that this function is exposed. The best GPS time is determined by checking if we have an accurate GPS time from the receiver. If not, we will try SNTP time. We may not get any time update from the receiver and SNTP. We will fall back to the most recent valid time. If the old GPS time is not good to use, fall back to the old SNTP time. If we don't have an accurate time, system time will be returned instead.

Example Usage 

 // Declare an integer to hold the current GPS time.
 U32 GPSTime;
 
 // Get the GPS time from the system.
 GPSTime = RXN_MSL_GetBestGPSTime();
U08 RXN_MSL_GetDataAccess (  ) 

Get the setting of data access.

Returns:
MSL_DATA_ACCESS_DISABLED if the system disallows for download of data.
MSL_DATA_ACCESS_ENABLED if the system disallows for download of data.
MSL_DATA_ACCESS_UNDEFINED if the data access has not been set yet.

Description
This function is used to get the setting of data access. If gMSL_Respect_Data_Settings is set to TRUE then we will smartly determine if the system allows for download of data. If gMSL_Respect_Data_Settings is set to FALSE we will blindly allow for data.

Example Usage 

 if(RXN_MSL_GetDataAccess() != MSL_DATA_ACCESS_ENABLED)
 {
     printf("Network access not available or allowed.\n");
 }
U16 RXN_MSL_GetEphemeris ( U32  prnBitMask,
RXN_MSL_NavDataList_t *  pNavModelData,
RXN_constel_t  constel 
)

Get extended ephemeris from the Mobile Suite Library.

Parameters:
prnBitMask [In] prnBitMask is a bitmask where bit0 is equal to PRN1, bit1 is PRN2 ...
pAssist [In] A RXN_MSL_NavDataList_t structure that is populated with ephemeris data.
constel [In] The constellation to get seed information. Must be one of the types of RXN_constel.
Returns:
RXN_SUCCESS if assistance is acquired successfully.
RXN_FAIL if no assistance data could be returned.

Description
Use this function to acquire MSL assistance data.

See Also
RXN_MSL_Abort()

Example Usage 

 // Declare a storage for assistance data.
 RXN_MSL_NavDataList_t navData;

 memset((void*) &navData, 0, sizeof(RXN_MSL_NavDataList_t));

 // Abort generating ephemeris.
 RXN_MSL_Abort(TRUE);
 
 // Get assistance from the MSL.
 Result = RXN_MSL_GetEphemeris(0xFFFFFFFF, &navData, RXN_GPS_CONSTEL);
 
 // Allow generating ephemeris.
 RXN_MSL_Abort(FALSE);
See also:
RXN_MSL_TriggerAssistance
U16 RXN_MSL_GetSNTPTime ( RXN_RefTime_t *  pRefTime  ) 

Get the current GPS time derived from SNTP time.

Parameters:
pRefTime [Out] The current GPS time derived from SNTP time in RXN_RefTime_t format.
Returns:
RXN_SUCCESS if SNTP time is the current time source.
RXN_FAIL if current time source isn't SNTP.

Description
This function obtains the current time received from a SNTP server and returns it in RXN_RefTime_t format.

Example Usage 

 // Declare a storage to hold the current GPS time in RXN_RefTime_t format.
 RXN_RefTime_t refTime;

 if(RXN_MSL_GetSNTPTime(&refTime) != RXN_SUCCESS)
 {
     printf("The current time source isn't SNTP.\n");
 }
U16 RXN_MSL_Initialize ( void   ) 

Initialize the Mobile Suite Library to support generating synthetic EE.

Returns:
RXN_SUCCESS if the MSL is initialized successfully.
RXN_MSL_EOL_ERR if EOL (End of Life) file exists.
RXN_MSL_INIT_ERR for all other errors.

Description
Initialize the MSL component including validating license key and security key, checking EOL status, initializing the O/S abstraction layer and spawning a messaging thread.

Example Usage 

 // Initialize the MSL.
 if(RXN_MSL_Initialize() != RXN_SUCCESS)
 {
     // Shutdown the CL.
     RXN_CL_Uninitialize(gCL_Handle);

     // Shutdown the CL logger.
     RXN_CL_Log_UnInit();

     // Shutdown the MSL logger.
     RXN_MSL_Log_UnInit();

     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
 }
U16 RXN_MSL_Load_Config ( const char  configPath[RXN_MSL_MAX_CONFIG_PATH]  ) 

Load the configuration file. This must be called before RXN_MSL_Initialize().

Parameters:
configPath [In] Specifies the path to a config file. This file will contain config parameters used by the MSL. Detail on the MSL config file can be found within the PGPS Integration Guide.
Returns:
RXN_SUCCESS if the configuration file is loaded successfully.
RXN_MSL_CONFIG_FORMAT_ERR if the configPath string does not support opening a config file.
RXN_FAIL for all other errors.

Description
Read the MSLConfig.txt and configure the MSL to operate based on those inputs.

See Also
RXN_MSL_Initialize()

Example Usage 

 #define RXN_CONFIG_FILE       ".\\MSLConfig.txt"
 if(RXN_MSL_Load_Config(RXN_CONFIG_FILE) != RXN_SUCCESS)
 {
     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
 }
U16 RXN_MSL_Log_Init (  ) 

Initialize a log for MSL use.

Returns:
RXN_SUCCESS if the log is initialized successfully or if the log is disabled.
RXN_MSL_FILE_OPEN_OR_CLOSE_ERR if a log file cannot be opened.

Description
Open a log file that can be used by the MSL for logging. If the log file exists, it will be appended. If the log file does not exist, it will be created. Note that all instances of the MSL will share a common log.

Example Usage 

 if(RXN_MSL_Log_Init() != RXN_SUCCESS)
 {
     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
 }
void RXN_MSL_Log_UnInit ( void   ) 

Un-Initialize a log that has been opened for MSL use.

Description
Close a previously opened log file (if opened).

Example Usage 

 // Shutdown the MSL logger. Always shutdown logging last to ensure that
 // any MSL issues that precedes this call are logged.
 RXN_MSL_Log_UnInit();
U08 RXN_MSL_ProcessRinexFile ( const char  rinexFile[RXN_MSL_MAX_PATH],
RXN_constel_t  constel 
)

This function supports importing ephemeris data from a Rinex file.

Parameters:
rinexFile [In] Specifies the path to a Rinex file.
constel [In] The constellation to process a Rinex file. Must be one of the types of RXN_constel.
Returns:
RXN_SUCCESS if ephemeris is imported successfully.
RXN_FAIL for any errors.

Description
Use this function to process a Rinex file and write ephemeris to the eph folder. This function processes one file only. Call this function multiple times if you have more than one Rinex files to process. Rinex files must be processed in chronological order.

Example Usage 

 #define RINEX_FILE       "/data/rinex/rinex_file"

 // Process a GPS Rinex file.
 Result = RXN_MSL_ProcessRinexFile(RINEX_FILE, RXN_GPS_CONSTEL);
void RXN_MSL_RemoveBCEObserver ( RXN_MSL_Ephemeris_Callback  callback  ) 

Removes an observer from BCE notifications.

void RXN_MSL_SetDataAccess ( BOOL  isEnabled  ) 

Enable or disable download of data.

Parameters:
isEnabled [In] TRUE to enable data access or FALSE to disable data access.

Description
This function is used to control data access. If isEnabled is set to TRUE, MSL is allowed to download data. If isEnabled is set to FALSE, all seed download requests and SNTP requests will be ignored.

Example Usage 

 if(dataEnabled > 0)
 {
     RXN_MSL_SetDataAccess(TRUE);
 }
 else
 {
     RXN_MSL_SetDataAccess(FALSE);
 }
U16 RXN_MSL_SetGLOTime ( U08  N4,
U16  NT,
U08  tb 
)

Set the current GLONASS time.

Parameters:
N4 [In] The GLONASS N4 parameter: The number of 4 year periods since 1996.
NT [In] The GLONASS NT parameter: The number of days elapsed in the current 4 year period
tb [In] The GLONASS tb parameter: The number of 15 minutes periods elapsed in the current day
Returns:
RXN_SUCCESS if time has been set successfully (always).
Attention:
Integrators have the responsibility to provide accurate time to the system.

Description
This function takes the set of GLONASS time parameters and sets accurate GNSS time within the MSL.

U16 RXN_MSL_SetGPSTime ( RXN_RefTime_t *  pRefTime  ) 

Set the current GPS time.

Parameters:
pRefTime [In] The current GPS time in RXN_RefTime_t format
Returns:
RXN_SUCCESS if time has been set successfully (always).
Attention:
Integrators have the responsibility to provide accurate time to the system.

Description
MSL implementation requires target-specific support for setting the current GPS time. This value may also be required outside the MSL by integration applications. It is for the above reason that this function is exposed.

Example Usage 

 // Declare an integer to hold the GPS time retrieved from receiver in seconds.
 U32 actualGPSTime;

 // Declare a storage to hold the GPS time in RXN_RefTime_t format.
 RXN_RefTime_t refTime;
 
 // Get actual GPS time from receiver.
 actualGPSTime = GetActualGPSTime();

 // Take the 1024 week roll over into account.
 refTime.weekNum = (actualGPSTime / 604800) % 1024;
 refTime.TOWmSec = (actualGPSTime % 604800) * 1000;
 refTime.TAccmSec = 1;
 
 // Set time from receiver.
 RXN_MSL_SetGPSTime(&refTime);
U16 RXN_MSL_SetLeapSecondsInfo ( U08  curLeapSecVal,
U08  nextLeapSecVal,
U32  nextLeapSecGPStime 
)

Sets the latest leap second information.

Parameters:
curLeapSecVal [In] The current leap second value.
nextLeapSecVal [In] Currently this parameter only supports a value of curLeapSecVal or curLeapSecVal + 1. [Provisioned for future use. Current PGPS 6.x core supports +1 second leap seconds only.]
nextLeapSecGPStime [In] When the next leap second will occur, in GPS seconds.
Returns:
RXN_SUCCESS if leap second information has been set successfully.
RXN_FAIL if the information was rejected.

Description
This function sets the leap seconds that will be used by the MSL to handle a leap second roll over, and perform the appropriate adjusts when converting between time systems (UTC, GPS, GLONASS).

U16 RXN_MSL_SetLeapSecondsInfoKP ( U08  kP,
U08  N4,
U16  NA 
)

Sets the latest leap second information by supplying KP value from GLONASS almanac.

Parameters:
kP [In] The KP value obtained from GLONASS almanac. This value determines what happens at the end of the current quarter year (UTC).
N4 [In] The N4 value obtained from GLONASS almanac. This value is the number of leap years that have occurred since 1996. N4 and NA combined are used to determine our current year.
NA [In] The NA value obtained from GLONASS almanac. This value is the number of days since the last leap year. N4 and NA combined are used to determine our current year.
Returns:
RXN_SUCCESS if leap second information has been set successfully.
RXN_FAIL if the information was rejected.

Description
This function sets the leap seconds that will be used by the MSL to handle a leap second roll over, and perform the appropriate adjusts when converting between time systems (UTC, GPS, GLONASS).

void RXN_MSL_TriggerAssistance ( U32  assistTypeBitMask,
U32  gpsPrnBitMask,
U32  gloSlotBitMask 
)

This function starts an asynchronous assistance request. In order to be notified when assistance is available, register as an observer using the observer interface.

See also:
RXN_MSL_AddEEObserver
RXN_MSL_AddLocationObserver
RXN_MSL_AddBCEObserver
Parameters:
assistTypeBitMask [IN] Use the bit flags defined in RXN_MSL_Assistance_Type to select which products will supply assistance.
gpsPrnBitMask [IN] Select the GPS prn's for which assistance is provided using this bitmask where bit0 is equal to PRN1, bit1 is PRN2 ...
gloSlotBitMask [IN] Select the GLONASS prn's for which assistance is provided using this bitmask where bit0 is equal to PRN1, bit1 is PRN2 ...

Description
RXN_MSL_TriggerAssistance starts acquiring assistance from the products requested in assistTypeBitMask. As assistance becomes available from each product, the assistance is provided to EE, location, and BCE observers.

Example Usage

 static void ephCallback(RXN_MSL_NavDataList_t* ephemeris, RXN_constel_t constel)
 {
     RXN_CL_WriteEphemeris(mCL_Handle, ephemeris, constel);
 }
 
 static void locationCallback(RXN_RefLocation_t* location)
 {
     RXN_CL_SetRefLocTime(mCL_Handle, location, NULL);
 }

 ...
 void init()
 {
     RXN_MSL_AddEEObserver(ephCallback);
     RXN_MSL_AddBCEObserver(ephCallback);
     RXN_MSL_AddLocationObserver(locationCallback);
 }

 void getAssistance()
 {
     RXN_MSL_TriggerAssistance(RXN_MSL_ASSISTANCE_ALL, 0xFFFFFFFF, 0x00FFFFFF);
 }
U16 RXN_MSL_Uninitialize ( void   ) 

Un-Initialize Mobile Suite Library (MSL).

Returns:
RXN_SUCCESS if the MSL is stopped successfully.
RXN_FAIL for all errors.

Description
Un-initialize the MSL component including freeing cache memory, aborting any ephemeris generation that may be underway, un-initializing thread protection, un-initializing the O/S abstraction to free resources and stopping the MSL logger.

See Also
RXN_MSL_Initialize()

Example Usage 

 // Stop the MSL.
 if(RXN_MSL_Uninitialize()!= RXN_SUCCESS)
 {
     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
 }
U16 RXN_MSL_Work ( void   ) 

Give the Mobile Suite Library implementation time to perform PGPS tasks.

Returns:
RXN_SUCCESS if PGPS work is done successfully (always).

Description
Give the MSL a chance to work. Perform a single step towards any outstanding tasks required to support generation of EE. Tasks will depend on the MSL state machine.

Example Usage 

 // Declare a flag to control exit
 static BOOL gRun = TRUE;
 
 while(gRun)
 {
     // Give other threads some cycles.
     Sleep(50);
           
     if(RXN_MSL_Work() != RXN_SUCCESS)
     {
          break;
     }
 }
U16 RXN_MSL_WriteEphemeris ( RXN_FullEphem_u  PRNArr,
U08  ArrSize,
RXN_constel_t  constel 
)

Write an array of broadcast ephemeris data into the MSL. It is preferable to use RXN_MSL_WriteSingleEphemeris() instead so that it is possible to determine whether the ephemeris for a specific PRN was written successfully.

Parameters:
PRNArr [In] An array of RXN_FullEph_t structs that will be populated with broadcast ephemeris data.
ArrSize [In] The number of array elements allocated in memory.
constel [In] The satellite constellation the ephemeris is for. Must be one of the types of RXN_constel.
Returns:
RXN_SUCCESS if all ephemeris is written successfully.
RXN_MSL_SET_EPHEMERIS_ERR if the data for one or more PRN's failed to write

Description
The autonomous mode functionality will consume PRN broadcast ephemeris data records so that it may model PRN locations and generate EE for PRNs. Predicted GPS (PGPS) functionality will consume broadcast ephemeris and update internal clocks using clock data that is included within broadcast ephemeris data.

To enable optimal collections for autonomous mode this function should be called periodically at 5 minute intervals regardless of GPS fix status to ensure in a general use case of 20 minutes it will make at least 3 collections.

U16 RXN_MSL_WriteSingleEphemeris ( RXN_Ephemeris_u *  eph,
RXN_constel_t  constel 
)

Write broadcast ephemeris data into the MSL. To enable optimal collections for autonomous mode this function should be called periodically at 5 minute intervals regardless of GPS fix status to ensure in a general use case of 20 minutes it will make at least 3 collections.

Parameters:
eph [In] The ephemeris data to write
constel [In] The satellite constellation the ephemeris is for. Must be one of the types of RXN_constel.
Returns:
RXN_SUCCESS if ephemeris is written successfully.,
RXN_FAIL for all errors.

Description
The autonomous mode functionality will consume PRN broadcast ephemeris data records so that it may model PRN locations and generate EE for PRNs. Predicted GPS (PGPS) functionality will consume broadcast ephemeris and update internal clocks using clock data that is included within broadcast ephemeris data.

Example Usage 

 RXN_Ephemeris_u ephemeris;
 
 // Loop through PRNs checking for BCE changes for each.
 for(U08 Idx = 0; Idx < RXN_CONSTANT_NUM_PRNS; Idx++)
 {
      // Get BCE from the receiver. The following example application would return
      // "TRUE"  if BCE had changed for the specified PRN (first param).
      if(GetBCE(Idx, &ephemeris) == TRUE)
      {
          // Records with readBCEArr[].prn == 0 will be ignored.
          if(ephemeris.gpsEphemeris.prn != 0) 
          {
              // Write ephemeris 
              RXN_MSL_WriteSingleEphemeris(&ephemeris, RXN_GPS_CONSTEL);
          }   
      }
 }
